Ethical.net

Who they are

Ethical.net is a not-for-profit project building a free and open platform for discovering ethical alternatives to stuff — whether that means buying from a social enterprise, charity shopping, or learning how to fix your old phone instead of buying a new one. They are currently in the process of building the platform, already created a repository of ethical alternatives.


What they need

Ethical.net is looking for two roles: one on scalability of existing infrastructure, and one to improve the relevance of content.

Wordpress / architect role

Ethical.net would like to become more confident of the technical decisions made so far, and understand the potential scalability bottlenecks they are likely to hit in the future. In addition, they need someone to help out their Wordpress CMS.

Data Science role

Ethical.net is looking for someone who would be interested in using data science techniques to properly optimise the content shown to users. This would involve crafting algorithms and generating quantified data to support the approach.

Both projects will involve client engagement, scope setting and agreeing to timelines. You will join a 4-person team including project manager, content creator, marketeer, developer.


This project would be interesting for

Experienced developers looking to move into system architecture design. This would be a good role for someone interested in performance tuning and getting experience with scaling problems.

Junior data scientists looking to build out their portfolio. This would be good for someone who is interested in data science / optimisation and would like to work on A/B testing.


Questions?

If you’re not sure you qualify, or have other questions, feel free to send us an email: info@radicalengineers.com. Tom is happy to tell you more!
